If another modulation \\(e^{2\\pi i f_1 t}\\) is applied as an intervention at a later time, will the ultimate frequency spectrum solely reflect a shift of \\(f_0 + f_1\\) from the original \\(X(f)\\)?
Explanation: Applying a second modulation by \\(e^{2\\pi i f_1 t}\\) cumulatively adds to the frequency shift introduced by the first modulation.
